articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian and Ukrainian negotiators will meet in Istanbul for their first peace talks in more than three years as both sides come under pressure from U.S. President Donald Trump to end Europe's deadliest conflict since World War Two.
articles.title: Russia and Ukraine to hold first direct peace talks in over three years

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli strikes on Gaza have killed more than 250 people since Thursday morning, local health authorities said, one of the deadliest phases of bombardment since a truce collapsed in March and with a new ground offensive expected soon.
articles.title: Deadly Israeli strikes pound Gaza as Trump says 'people are starving'

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: An official appointed by Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban to investigate foreign political interference met with Trump administration officials this week in what U.S. officials saw as a bid to enlist their help against Orban's perceived enemies in advance of elections expected next year.
articles.title: Exclusive: Hungarian official sought information on perceived Orban opponents in USAID meeting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of Libyan protesters called on Friday for the ouster of the internationally-recognised prime minister and his government said one security force member was killed when some protesters tried to storm his office.
articles.title: Libyan protesters demand prime minister quit as three ministers resign

articles.author: Cassandra Garrison, Emily Green
articles.description: No sooner had 23-year-old beauty influencer Valeria Marquez been murdered on a TikTok livestream than the Mexican rumor mill started. Comments poured in on social media blaming her for her own death: She was involved in shady business, her ex-boyfriend was a narco, she had it coming, they said.
articles.title: In Mexico, first outrage, then victim blaming over murdered TikTok influencer

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's ousted former President Yoon Suk Yeol said on Saturday that he is leaving the conservative People Power Party, according to his Facebook post.
articles.title: South Korea ex-President Yoon says he is leaving conservative party

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vietnam and the United States held their first direct ministerial-level negotiations on Friday against the backdrop of an impending U.S. tariff of 46% on imports from the Southeast Asian nation, which could significantly impact its growth.
articles.title: Vietnam steps up talks with US to reduce hefty tariff

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The man who stabbed and partially blinded novelist Salman Rushdie onstage at a Western New York arts institute in 2022 was sentenced to 25 years in prison on Friday for an attack that also wounded a second man, the district attorney said.
articles.title: Assailant who stabbed author Salman Rushdie sentenced to 25 years

articles.author: Jessica Donati, Emma Farge, Ammu Kannampilly, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: The food stocks have been stuck inside four U.S. government warehouses since the Trump administration's decision in January to cut global aid programs.
articles.title: Exclusive: US aid cuts leave food for millions mouldering in storage

articles.author: Angelo Amante
articles.description: In a rundown neighbourhood of Sicily's capital Palermo, a whitewashed old farmhouse that accommodates pilgrims now offers two rooms to tourists for bed and breakfast after a renovation.
articles.title: Too many tourists? Crowds offer an opportunity for Italy's south
